citation.article-title: Saccharothrix: a new genus of the Actinomycetales related to Nocardiopsis.

p.s: Saccharothrix (Sac.' cha. ro. thrix. Gr. neut. noun sacchar sugar; Gr. fem. noun thrix hair; Saccharothrix sugar-containing hair)
Branching vegetative mycelium (diameter, approximately 0.5 Î¼m) and, on some media, aerial mycelium are produced.
Both vegetative and aerial hyphae fragment into ovoid elements.
The cell wall is type III (meso-diaminopimelic acid) and has a whole-cell sugar pattern consisting of major amounts of galactose and rhamnose.
No nocardomycolic acids are present in the cells.
The guanine-plus-cytosine content of the DNA is 73 mol%.
The type species is Saccharothrix australiensis.
